arts.ttl: Roma begin search for Juric’s replacement: Mancini leads the race
arts.sum: Following Roma’s home defeat against Bologna, the club has officially parted ways with Ivan Juric. The Friedkin family, despite expressing confidence in Juric just days ago, made the decision to terminate his contract. In an official statement, Roma thanked Juric for his hard work and professionalism during his brief tenure, acknowledging the challenging environment he managed. Calciomercato report that the search for a new technical director is already underway, with an announcement expected in the coming days. Roberto Mancini has emerged as the frontrunner to replace Juric. arts.ttl: Roma crisis deepens with loss to Bologna and Juric fired. Atalanta and Fiorentina join Napoli at top
arts.sum: Roma announced shortly after the game that Juric had been fired, marking the club’s second coaching change this season. Atalanta and Fiorentina both won to move level on points with Serie A leader Napoli, which visits defending champion Inter Milan later Sunday.

arts.ttl: European football: Roma sack coach Ivan Juric after just 12 games in charge
arts.sum: Croatian’s final match was 3-2 home loss to Bologna Julián Alvarez scores winner for Atlético Madrid Roma have sacked Ivan Juric after only 12 matches in charge. The Croatian became the second Roma head coach to be fired this season after the side’s 3-2 home defeat by Bologna on Sunday, their fourth loss in the last five league games which left them 12th in the Serie A table. “We would like to thank Ivan Juric for his hard work these past weeks,” Roma said in a statement. “He handled a difficult environment with the utmost professionalism, and for that we are grateful. The search for a new head coach has already begun and an announcement will be made in the coming days.” This article will be updated. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Roma sack manager Juric after 12 matches in charge
arts.sum: Roma are looking for their third manager of the season after sacking Croatian Ivan Juric, who replaced previous boss Daniele de Rossi in September.
